Reviews.Title: “lousy hotel....”
Reviews.Author: lulung20
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel recently..very lousy.. and expensive..really not worth..room so small even though family room and smelly too..no kettle for boiling water..mineral water also need to pay..no free wi-fi...tv not not in order..breakfast very lousy..staff unfriendly.. but one thing good is that mcdonald is just opposite the hotel and kfc is just a few steps away..metro station also nearby..

Reviews.Title: “Booked rooms in landmark plaza hotel for my family.”
Reviews.Author: S_H_A_I_K_19
Reviews.Content: Dear Tripadvisor viewers, Reserved two rooms for my family with children in this hotel in jan 2012. kindly let me know whether to stay in hotel or cancel my booking? Is this hotel suitable for children? Booked in this hotel as it is close to baniyas metro station. SA

Reviews.Title: “Only for business trip.”
Reviews.Author: Kristy_Kitty
Reviews.Content: It`s poor hotel in a noisy part of Dubai. It`s ok if u re coming in hotel only for sleep,and whole day spending outside for shoping or other busyness things. The food is poor,,mean breakfast just tomatos,cheese and omlets. Everyday the same with the difference may be sosiges,, Rooms are poor,the bathrooms terrible,,, There are some electronic shops on oposite side of hotel,,where u can buy what u need for home.Also there is a Macdonald,if u ll feel hungry u can take something there.

Reviews.Title: “50/50 construction going on outside a real eye sore”
Reviews.Author: Felistus
Reviews.Content: I did not have a problem with the rooms given the general prices in Dubai for accomodation however the shower was built in such a way that the water flows out of the cubicle onto the floor- messy. The food was standard we only had breakfast though. The front of the hotel was rater an eyesore due to the metro station construction i am not sure if they are done now. The first room we got had a noisy aircon but they agreed to move us without a problem. English channels very limited on tv.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Deira stay”
Reviews.Author: solo40Nigeria
Reviews.Content: Landmark is ideal for the trader who has to be in the deira market area. You can walk from place to place and a good choice of eating area around. Golden fork, KFC, Mac donalds are all in the vicinity of the hotel opening till the 2am or more. the down side was the fact that there was no internet service in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A worthless Hotel in Dubai is "Landmark Plaza"”
Reviews.Author: ismilewhenyousmile
Reviews.Content: Since 20 days continuously I was sending email to Landmark Plaza hotel's email address for booking a room for our GM & his family members from 07 May to 14 May 2011 and nobody respond to my mail. A hotel with lack of information technology considered to be worthless. I was sending emails from my email address ismilewhenyousmile@gmail.com to lanplaza@emirates.net.ae (hotel's official email as shown in their website). Also I called hotel & a female with Indian accent answer my phone & I requested her to reply my mail, and she promised to reply ASAP. Since then till today I didnt receive any reply from them so far. Should I still recommend this hotel as good one? +255-78-2386164

Reviews.Title: “I did not feel safe, hotel smells”
Reviews.Author: suetz
Reviews.Content: On transit between KL to Milan so stayed 1 night at hote Plaza in Dubai as recommended by Emirates. I couldnt stand the thick smell from the reception to my room and the lift lobby on my room floor. Had a call in the middle of the night from reception and someone came to knock on my door in the middle of the night. Hotel staff advised me to change around Euro40 for meals and buying water etc. Perhaps they were expecting me to go to a classy restuarant as the shawarma outside cost like 4 Dirham (like 1 Euro!). There was english reruns on TV though. Area at night was just very crowded and full of people.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: linda_NZTePuke
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of October. The weather was not too hot and we could walk to the gold and spice souk - about 15 mins. The hotel was easy to find and always taxis passing outside to take you to the attractions. The square outside is being turned into a metro station - bit noisy but we weren't there much during the day. Great when it is finished. Rooms were big and clean. Staff friendly and helpful. Got a very early check-in which I asked for by email. Breakfast was plentiful and for everyone's tastes. The reception will book you a safari if you want. Good value. Older hotel but in good shape. Lots of Russians and signs in Russian around the place. Good if you want fur coats! Lots of cheap shops in the vicinity. After dark the pavements turn into little restaurants and you can eat cheap and tasty souvlaki style meals. English menus too. Try the fresh juices. There are juice bars every where and juices are on all the menus. Juiced right there in front of you. A whole coconut is really cheap. Loved Dubai at this time of the year. Dubai mall has great shopping - some expensive. Go down to the food hall - and book at least one day ahead for the worlds tallest building. 5 minute walk from the hotel to the 'Creek' and a boat across. You'll be asked if you want a cruise as well. Go, but make sure of the price. If you want to get to the gold and spice souk from the hotel go down to the creek and walk along there, following the road signs for the souks then go into the back streets. Easy to get lost but easy to find a way back!!! Mosques in the area, and lots of local life!!! The hotel does advertise 2 restaurants but only one was open but this was fine. We had one midday meal there - another buffet and lots to choose from and very economical.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: ChelseaYoung
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to get the real Dubai experience and not a beach resort holiday Landmark plaza is in a excellent location. The hotel provides a good service with clean and spacious rooms. Make sure you get a room with a balcony to experience the beauty of Al Nasser Square. The hotel is just minutes from the bazaars and souks as well as the water front. Taking a cab to and from the airport cost about 30 dirhams and geting to Jumeriah beach cost roughly the same. Diera city centre is a quick 5 minute cab ride costing 5-7 dirhams. Eatting around the hotel is very diverse with plenty of local cheap food (shawarmas) and a McDonalds across the street. The hotel offers air conditioning, fridge with refreshments, tv, tourist information, breakfast and ironing facilities.

Reviews.Title: “So central”
Reviews.Author: calina666
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. Room overlooked Nasser Square and had a view of the Creek. Walking distance to all hotel bars & restaurants, also to the Gold Souk. A courtesy bus was put on to take you to the beach and to collect you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: FyingKiwi
Reviews.Content: Well located to all the major sights.Good value for money. Willingness of staff to be helpful when asked. Electrical fittings (plugs) were very dubious. Also spoilt by one hotel member discouraging us from going to the restauraunt for a cup of coffee, and instead, offering to make us one in th guest;s coffee room instead. This he did, then charged us a higher price than he should have.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: whitex5
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Landmark for 2 nights on route to thailand,with my husband and three children,I have never written a review before but can honestly say this is the worst hotel i have ever had the misfortune to stay in.Despite having pre booked an early check-in time 8.30 due to a night flight from london,the hotel reception staff had no record of this and could not have been less interested.They made no apologies for the room not being ready but dismissed us to wait in the foyer. We got to our room 1/12 hours later with some very tired children, the room although large was dismal,no windows and dark green. We had interconnecting rooms but on arrival to the room the inter connecting door was locked,we didnt get this key until 10.30 pm!! on returning to our room later that evening ,we found water pouring from the ceiling.On reporting this to reception,a succesion of staff came to look at it and mop the ..floor. The maintenance staff worked in our room for the next 2 hours !! finally leaving at 1.50 am!! They could not offer us another suitable room,and i had to make several phone calls to reception,we were not even offered a drink, until i demanded at least a cup of tea as we were unable to go to bed.A very bad start to our holiday,dont stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Russia!”
Reviews.Author: IceZebra99
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a weekend in Dubai, we wanted to stay central for easy access to the shops. Didn't realise that we would end up in Russia though!! The hotel is above 3 floors of Russian owned shops (including 4 fur coat shops!) The hotel staff all speak Russian and the cooked breakfast items sounded very Russian!! As for the room, that was adequate and yes the shower leaks! Just put some towels on the floor and it's alright. The room was large and clean. The decor was a tad dated, but we didn't spend much time in there so no real bother! The coffee shop was a real winner, fresh juice, decent coffee and proper tea on demand. Plus there was a computer with cheap internet access. The location is outstanding, just one block from the abra station (the boat that goes across the creek to Dubai side). The Gold Souk a five minute walk the other way and plenty of good restaurants in close proximity. In a place where you get where you pay for, this is a decent shopping base for those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location & Price, Would Definately Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: Elonii
Reviews.Content: I've read a few negative reviews about the Landmark and so I wasn't sure what to expect! For the money though, the hotel rooms were extremely nice. We had one of the rooms on the 10th floor and even had a view of the river from our balcony. The rooms themselves were spotlessly presented with brand new furniture, fittings and new flooring. There is also a mini bar (no alcohol) which is very reasonably priced. The fridge also gives plenty of space to pop in your own beverages. Most handy. As we were aware, there is a new metro station being constructed outside the hotel. However when we were there the noise generated was no worse than the general street noise. Staff were extremely helpful and polite. No, their english might not be the best but it was good enough to help us with everything we needed. They were very attentive and looked after all our requirements well. A few people have moaned about the breakfast. There was melon, toast, cerial, pastries, cakes as well as the cooked breakfast (which was not the best I must admit). I thought it was perfectly adequate to fill your travelling tummy, but not excellent. Cakes and pastries particularly handy to nick for consumption during the big bus tour!! The bathrooms were a wee bit small, and the shower did indeed leak water all over the floor. However, we simply mopped the floor with our bath mat after each use and found that meant there was no mess. The location of the hotel is absolutely brilliant. Within walking distance to the creek, Gold Souk & Spice Souk. Also convenient for the stop to get you on the big bus tour. I don't think we could have asked for more for the money we paid. The room was cleaned every day to our satisfaction, and we geniunely could not find fault with this place. It'll be even better once the metro is complete. Worth a go for those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Once”
Reviews.Author: Dubwah
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Landmark Plaza 3 nights with my mum. We arrived at 8am after a 20 hour flight, and check in is at 2pm. That was fine. We were just going to drop off our bags and have a walk around the area before the jet-lag set in. However, the reception staff advised us that we could check in early, that our room would be ready soon. So we waited, and were basically ignored. Three and a half hours later we were shown to our room. (This was 20 minutes after my mum had a stern word to the reception staff). We had to leave our passports at the front desk – which was a little odd. The room on the top floor was large, clean and cool. There were no windows, but it had an enormous balcony off the room. The balcony didn’t have any views as it was surrounded by high walls. The bathroom was also large, with a bath/shower (water leaked all over the floor no matter how carefully you showered). We had breakfast twice in the restaurant. The buffet was ordinary, but quite adequate. The restaurant staff seemed disinterested in service. There is a great café/restaurant on the opposite side of Al Naseer square called Tavolino. Great fresh juices and shawarma. The hotel is a favourite with Russian tourists. Even the sight-seeing advisor for the hotel is Russian. I asked where the closet stop for the Big Bus Tour was – I was advised ‘Abra Station’. It isn’t. The closest stop is on Baniyas road – directly opposite the Riviera Hotel. (The Big Bus Tour is well worth doing – it gives you a good overview of Dubai). The hotel is located in an interesting part of the city – close to the souqs and the creek. Make use of the abras – the best way to cross the creek. The men in this area do ogle at western females – just dress conservatively and ignore them. We tired to book at the Novotel, Ibis and Riviera hotels but they were fully booked. The Landmark Plaza was our fourth option. The hotel was okay, but next time I will stay somewhere with airport transfers included, and maybe closer to the beach…

Reviews.Title: “reasonable for the price”
Reviews.Author: dreadownunder
Reviews.Content: myself and partner stayed for a couple of nights during a brief stop over in Dubai. Firstly, it is more like a 2 star, not 3!!! The location was okay, pretty close to the creek and maybe 10 - 15 mins walk to the gold souk. For the price, the hotel was not bad, the room was fairly large and clean, the air con worked however, our room on the top floor was extremely noisy due to the fan outside for the aircon, plus there is currently a lot of construction directly outside the hotel in Al Nasser square. be very clear on the rate you are charged as we ended up paying about AUD $70 more than the quoted rate through expedia. we found the desk staff fairly rude, although we were able to book the 'big bus tour' through the hotel which I would recommend as an easy way of getting around and inc. a creek cruise (well worth the ticket cost). not terribly impressed with the hotel restaurant and also struggled to find a decent eating establishment within close proximity. that said, I would probably stay there again as unless we win lotto, I dont think we can afford beach front in jumeriah!!!!!! taxi from airport was 30 dirhams (taxi stand just outside exit) and the hotel staff drove us to airport in morning (5am at breakneck speed) but transfer was not included in hotel tarrif.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: imys
Reviews.Content: Myself, my wife and 2 children stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. We were picked up at the airport by the hotels representative and all our luggage was carried up to our hotel room for no extra charge. We waited 15mins at the reception for a room because there was an issue with the correct one being available, after 15mins the lady at the reception gave us keys to the penthouse suite. i really couldnt ask for more as I didnt book the penthouse. All the activities were booked from the hotel and the staff were really helpful throughout our stay. The kids loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: PepperAustralia
Reviews.Content: For the price (compared to other hotels in Dubai) this hotel was more than adequate. It was clean, spacious and the staff were helpful. We arrived at 8am and they had our room ready in an hour even though it was advertised to be ready at 2pm so we were very pleased. We were travelling with our 2 children aged 6 and 8 and they put us in a suite room which was very spacious. My 2 daughthers and I had no problems with men staring any more than in any parts of Dubai.

HotelInfo.Name: Landmark Plaza Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Omar Bin Al Kattab Rd , Al Nasser Square | PO Box 42222, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
